content:
A definition gives a deterministic timeout which is solved by pushing the Time Limit to 200000.
Is there a way to trace Lean's behaviour to understand what takes so much time to compile?
set_option profiler true can be used to measure the various pieces of the def
One thing to try is replacing the implementation with sorry and see if that speeds it up, or if the _type_ of the def is the problem
Thanks! I could find out the the problem was due to the difficulty, for an ideal I of an R-algebra A, to view A/I as an R-module. Now, I pass through A/(I restrict_scalars R).
Antoine Chambert-Loir has marked this topic as resolved.
